Be_aware_removing_variable: * Be aware that removing variables will corrupt flows that are using that variable.
Name: Name
BLL_codings_are_expressions: BLL codings are expressions within text-arguments in flowcards.
In_every_app_that_supports:
In every App that supports BLL coding, for each text-argument in flowcards that goes through the BLL decoder, you can use
{[ expression ]}
.
Within_these_expressions: Within these expressions, you can use build-in modules, functions and your own customisable functions.
Method_date_explanation: This method will return the current date(time) in the entered format, with respect to the users defined locale (language) en timezone.
Method_date_optionally: Optionally you can supply the date(time), locale and/or timeZone.
Configure_locale_timezone: Here you can configure your locale (language) and timezone.
Later_on_each_app: Later on, you will be able to configure this from here separatly for each app that uses BLL coding
Create_custom_datetime_formats: Here you can create custom datetime definitions with any format you wish.
Alter_default_datetime_formats: Here you can alter the definition of any default datetime formats.
Applies_to_every_app: This will be applied to every app using the BLL coding or DateTime.
Configure_fileserver: Here you can configure the File Server that can be consumed by other apps, like Simple (Sys) LOG, to serve files on you LAN or to download them on the Homey Mobile App or the Developertools.
Configure_port_fileserver: Configure the Port for the File Server to use for incoming connections.
Automaticly_started_fileserver: The File Server can be automaticly started when BLL is started, speeding up the first File request.
Automaticly_shutdown_fileserver: You can close the server automaticly as soon as there are no more files currently waiting for download, saving resources.
defineFileAvailableDuration: Define the duration files will be available for download.
Shema_example: Here is an example schema to use in the format JSON as Excel flowcard.
excel_defaultdateformat_example: Here you can configure the default datetime format to use in Excel files. Please note that this is Excel formatting, not BLL coding.
Method_time_explanation: This method will return the given time in the entered format.
Contant_now_explanation: Contains the value of Date.now(), a numeric value representing the current moment in milliseconds, set once at the start of the expression.
Method_number_explanation: This method will return the given number in the given style.

settings.functions_expressions: These functions can be used within BLL expression.
settings.functions_be_aware: Be aware that removing functions could corrupt flows that are using that function.
settings.add_function_text: To create a function, enter a name and press Add Function.
settings.name: Name
settings.delete_all_confirm: Are you sure you wish to delete ALL functions?
settings.delete_confirm: Are you sure you wish to delete function __functionName__?
